title: Pennsylvania Supreme Court Declares Mail-In Ballots Without Dates Invalid
description: Republicans had sued to stop election officials from counting noncompliant ballots, which could again become a crucial point of contention in the battleground state.
dc:creator: Neil Vigdor and Ruth Fremson
media:description: Voters showing Beth Roth, 67, the ballot box clerk, right, their ballots before putting them in a drop box at the Board of Elections office in Doylestown, Pa., on Friday.
